page.title: 18THE RESERVOIR SOUTH REIGATE
page.content: In 1859 the Reigate Waterworks C0 was formed to supply water to a large part of Reigate.The works and Pumping Station were situated in "Sandy Lane" now known as Lyttleton Lane,a turning off Park Lane.The water was collected via a number of shallow wells,situated on the north side of a foot path lead_ ing from Park Lane near the overflow from Priory Lake.The supply of water started from the bottom of the hills that lie to the north of Reigate and through various channels finally reach -ed "the moors"on Reigate Heath. The water was then pumped to the large reservoir on the west end of Park Ridge.It is a brick tank which holds 83,000 gallons.This tank is now used for water regulating machinery. The pumping house still stands as a private house.
